subject: Issues with Pro X Ultra Pedals
description_text:
﻿Hi,

I’m struggling with a few issues with my Pro X Ultra pedals:

Random dropping out of the VAM pro haptic reactors. The haptic reactors will ‘crash’ and continually vibrate unless I unplug the power and then reinsert the usb cable in that order.
The signal from the pedals ‘sticks’ at various inputs making it impossible to drive.
When calibrating in iRacing all signals are erratic (bouncing all over the place extremely fast), everything is like this even the wheel and shifter. As soon as I unplug the pedals this stops.

So far I have tried:
65w powered USB hub with only the pedals connected
Pedals plugged directly into motherboard (2.0, 3.0 and 3.1 ports)
New control box from you guys (the resistor was incorrect in the previous one, the above problems are still there)
Earthing the rig
Earthing the pedals
Running with the haptic reactors unplugged
Disconnecting all other peripherals aside from pedals
Firmware updates
Software updates
Reinstalling Simsonn Manager
Recalibrating pedals
PC bios updates 
Pc chipset updates
USB drivers all reinstalled
Windows 11 up to date
The pc itself is a brand new high end build

I have tried everything I have tried above and all three issues are present regardless.

The pedals are great when they’re working, but I can only get them working for a few minutes at a time before they stick, or the reactors crash.

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated, I’m running out of ideas.

My order number is #SSN2230.

Kind regards,
Adam Shelton
M: 07585 110811
